text: The Juan River (), also known as Baiguo River (), Yisu River () and Xingle River (), is a left-bank tributary in the middle reaches of the Xiang River in Hunan, China. The river rises in the Changshan Mountains () of Shuangfeng County, and its main stream runs generally southwest to northeast through Shuangfeng, Hengshan and Xiangtan counties, joining the Xiang at Yisuhe of Xiangtan. The Juan River has a length of , and its drainage basin covers an area of .The length and river basin area of Juan River, according to huaxia.com or xiangtan.gov.cn. ==References== Category:Rivers of Hunan
title: Juan River
